initial_xuv_3xo_data.text: [{'url': 'https://cargraze.com/blog/2025-mahindra-xuv-3xo-specs-design-performance-and-safety', 'content': '2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety  | Cargraze Home Cars Car Blog Tools Loan EMI Calculator Mileage Calculator Sell Used Car Check RC Login/ Register Home Car Info 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety Published On Dec 24, 2024 By Cargraze for Car Info A Comprehensive Review of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in 2025: Features, Performance, and Value Are you looking for a compact yet powerful vehicle that combines performance, safety, and value in one stunning package? The Mahindra XUV 3XO might be the car youre searching for! Lets dive into a detailed review to see what this model brings in 2025. Design and Exterior Highlights One look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO, especially in black, and its clear that this car is a head-turner. Its sporty design elements stand out with: Chrome Accents: The grille and headlamp finish feature stylish chrome highlights. Projector Headlamps with LED DRLs: These enhance visibility and aesthetics. Diamond-Cut Alloy Wheels: The 16-inch alloys add a premium feel to the vehicle. Safety Ratings: With six airbags and a five-star Global NCAP safety rating, this vehicle excels in safety. Roof Rails & Spoilers: Gloss-black roof rails and a sleek spoiler give it a bold presence on the road. Although the car lacks front parking sensors and certain accessories come as add-ons, its robust styling and road presence more than makes up for these minor drawbacks. Interior Comfort and Technology Step inside the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and youll be greeted by a modern and comfortable cabin: Dual-Tone Dashboard: Soft-touch materials on the doors and satin finishes on the levers add a premium touch. Advanced Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch infotainment display paired with a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster ensures seamless access to information and entertainment. Steering Controls: A three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel includes controls for cruise and infotainment systems. Comfort Features: From automatic climate control with dual-zone functionality to wireless charging and a vanity mirror with illumination, convenience is a priority. While its disappointing that the glovebox isnt cooled or illuminated, the XUV 3XO compensates with thoughtful features like rear AC vents, adjustable headrests, and ample storage options. Performance and Engine Specifications Under the hood, the Mahindra XUV 3XO packs a punch with its turbocharged petrol engine: Engine Options: It comes with a 1.2-liter three-cylinder MPFI engine, delivering 109 BHP and 200 Nm of torque. Transmission: Choose between manual and automatic transmissions, depending on your driving preference. Fuel Efficiency: Mahindra claims an ARAI-certified mileage of 18.5 km/l, though real-world figures hover around 14-15 km/l. The cars ride quality, stability, and safety features like ABS with EBD, electronic stability control, and tyre pressure monitoring ensure a secure driving experience. Practicality and Storage With a 364-liter boot space, the XUV 3XO offers decent storage capacity. However, operating the boot can feel a bit cumbersome due to its electromagnetic button placement. The spare wheel, tool kit, and first-aid essentials are neatly arranged but require some effort to access. Final Thoughts The Mahindra XUV 3XO is an impressive contender in the compact SUV segment. While it has its minor quirks, the blend of safety, design, and performance makes it a strong value-for-money option in its price range. Would we recommend it? Absolutely! Add it to your shortlist and take it for a spin to see if its the perfect fit for your needs. Dont forget to share your thoughts on this versatile vehicle in the comments section! View showroom Find a deal The light SUV segment is one of the most competitive in the Australian market. It was once the domain of the Japanese and Korean manufacturers, but in recent years the Chinese have brought better and more advanced compact SUVs to market for under $30,000 drive-away. Within a short few months, Australias affordable, light-size, city-friendly SUV sector will gain another new member, this time from India in the form of the all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO . The name might be a mouthful, but the offering is serious, and it takes on the likes of the Chery Tiggo 4 , Hyundai Venue , Kia Stonic , Mazda CX-3 , Toyota Yaris Cross , Nissan Juke and Volkswagen T-Cross . In this segment Australian buyers are extremely price- and feature-conscious, which has seen the likes of the Tiggo 4 excel, while buyers preferring traditional brands at a more premium price have the option of household names like the Yaris Cross and Juke. Needless to say, Mahindra enters a very competitive market with its new XUV 3X0, but if it can get the price and the positioning right, its fourth model line in Australia brings the biggest opportunity yet for the Indian brand to increase its local sales volume. Ahead of its Australia launch in the coming weeks, and to determine if the Mahindra XUV 3XO is any good, we visited the companys test track located about two hours from Chennai in India. First things first, we were pleasantly surprised by the extent and scale of the brands research and development centre. Mahindra has what can only be described as a world-class facility at its disposal to not only develop cars but to also thoroughly test them. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is already on sale in the Indian domestic market, where it has been met with extreme demand, but vehicles headed to Australia are still undergoing final preparations including tuning. Unlike Chinese manufacturers, which bring media to their facilities and then put limits on how we can drive the vehicles in terms of speed and testing, the Indians basically handed us the keys at a high-speed test track and said have fun. Hence we tested numerous XUV 3XO vehicles at speeds in excess of 175km/h on banked turns, and we put the cars through a series of slalom tests and performed high-speed direction changes and other extreme tests that no buyer would ever put their car through. Enquire now The Small SUV is one of the most popular car segments in Australia, and Indian manufacturer, Mahindra, are looking to establish themselves at the budget end of a market. However, this is currently the territory of the Chery Tiggo 4. The Tiggo 4 and the pre-facelift Tiggo 4 Pro offers a comfortable, well-equipped package with a very competitive price tag. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is not, in fact, C-3POs new set of wheels as its name would suggest, but it is the Indian-marques latest offering with budget and value conscious customers in mind, lining up the Tiggo 4 squarely in its crosshair. However, the small SUV space is as competitive as it is abundant, and the 3XO will not only go toe-to-toe with the Tiggo 4, but also its rivals including the likes of the MG ZS, GWM Haval Jolion and Hyundai Venue. But can the new Mahindra find its feet in its segment? And can it take on the Tiggo 4? Value for Money How much does the 2026 Mahindra XUV 3XO cost? In order to take the fight to the Tiggo 4 and other value offerings in the small SUV segment, Mahindra had to get the price of the XUV 3XO right. They did. With prices starting from $23,990 drive away for the entry-level AX5L trim level, The Mahindra XUV 3XO arrives as one of the most competitively priced offerings in the segment. Its price tag matches that of the entry-level Tiggo 4 to the dollar, and its the same story when you go one level up to the AX7L model, priced at $26,990 drive away. Until August 31st, 2025, both 3XO trim levels will be discounted by $500 for introductory pricing, temporarily undercutting the Tiggo-4 as a result. Not only is the Mahindra XUV 3XO the joint cheapest small SUVs, its now also one of the cheapest new cars in Australia. 2026 Mahindra XUV 3XO Pricing: AX5L: $23,990 drive away AX7L: $26,990 drive away Options Metallic Paint (on all colours except white): $495 Are you interested in a Mahindra XUV 3XO and looking for the best price? Find a Deal! Exterior Styling Diamonds are Mahindra Despite wrapping a platform thats over a decade old, the Mahindra XUV 3XO arrives with a trendy, contemporary exterior design. It stands out in Mahindras Australian range as the most modern-looking vehicle on offer and sets itself apart in what is becoming an increasingly uniform segment. The styling is angular and striking, sporting a diamond theme most evident in the headlight design, the accents placed on the exterior trim including on the tail lights, roof rails and rear bumper, and the diamond cut alloy wheels. Additional touches such as the rear light bar and the two tone roof featured on some specs further aid in its effectiveness. Auto Industry Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling sub-compact SUV with segment-leading safety, powerful engines and new style in the market. NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 Facebook Telegram WhatsApp Twitter Copy Link The sub-compact SUV in India witnesseda huge disruption with the launch of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in April 2024. This heavily redesigned XUV300 successor has created a lot of buzz in the market, promising to fix the shortcomings of the previous model and introduce segment-first features. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications Specification Details Price Range Rs. 7.99 15.80 Lakh (ex-showroom) Engine Options 1.2L Turbo Petrol (110 bhp), 1.2L TGDi (129 bhp), 1.5L Diesel (115 bhp) Transmission 6-speed Manual, 6-speed Automatic, 6-speed AMT Safety Rating 5-star BNCAP Mileage 17.96-21.2 kmpl (ARAI) Boot Space 295 liters Fuel Tank 42 liters Ground Clearance 201 mm Wheelbase 2600 mm Seating Capacity 5 passengers Engine and Variants The XUV 3XO continues with the same set of engines seen on theolder version, with three options. The base 1.2-litre turbo petrol makes 110 bhp and 200 Nm, good enough for city driving with decent fuel efficiency of around 17-19 kmpl. The highlight is new 1.2-litreTGDi direct injection petrol, good 129 bhp and 230 Nm. Theres adequate mid-rangepunch in this engine and highway overtaking is a breeze. The new torque converter automatic transmission works well with both petrol engines, smoother than the jerky AMT. For diesel lovers, the 1.5-litre turbo diesel continues to be the best in class with 300 Nm torque. The manual transmission is seamless, but the AMT is reluctant in lower gears, especially in stop-and-go traffic. Design and Styling Updates Mahindra has completely redesigned the XUV 3XOs exterior. The new front face features vertically arranged headlamps with C-shaped LED DRLs, making itlook related to the XUV700. The wide grille has diamond-shaped detailing and connected LED tail-lamps. The side profile has chunky cladding and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels on higher variants. But the styling is divisive, some find it bold and fresh while others think its too dramatic for the segment. Interior Space and Features The cabin is a big upgrade over the previous model. Mahindra has given the XUV 3XO a free-standing 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system and matching digital instrument cluster, same as the XUV700. Space is excellent, with class-leading rear legroom for 5 adults. The dashboard has soft-touch materials and premium finishes on higher variants and plenty of storage spaces for practicality. Key Features: Panoramic sunroof (segment-first) Dual-zone automatic climate control 360-degree camera system Electronic parking brake with auto-hold Level 2 ADAS on top variants Safety and Build The XUV 3XOs biggest achievement is its 5-star BNCAP rating, making it one of the safest in the segment. All variants come with six airbags, all-wheel disc brakes and comprehensive safety features like ABS, EBD and ESP. Higher variants get advanced driver assistance features like forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist. The build quality is robust and users often praise it as tank-like. ALSO READ: Tata Harrier EV Launches Today with 600km Range and Premium Features Ride and Handling The suspension does a good job of handling Indian roads, the ride is compliant and absorbs bumps and undulations without compromisin', 'images': [], 'rank': 2}, {'url': 'https://ackodrive.com/news/mahindra-xuv-3xo-pros-and-cons/', 'content': "HOME BUY NEW CAR BLOG Home / Top stories and News / Mahindra XUV 3XO: Pros and Cons Mahindra XUV 3XO: Pros and Cons Published on 4 Jun, 2024, 10:52 AM IST Updated on 4 Jun, 2024, 12:01 PM IST Satvik Khare 8 min read Top stories and News Follow us on Share Post The XUV 3XO is an extensive facelift for the Mahindra XUV300. But is it a good buy? Contents The XUV 3XO is not a new-gen model but an extensive facelift. And its just not on the design front, but also the offerings. Mahindra received more than 50,000 bookings within an hour, so things have started on a positive note. So should you ride the wave and buy it? Well, we tell you both sides of the story. Pro - Powertrain Options Carried over from the XUV300, the XUV 3XO comes with a variety of powertrain options. You have a choice of a turbo-petrol engine in two states of tune and a diesel engine as well. You also get the option of a 6-speed manual, a 6-speed AMT and the new Aisin-sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic. Powertrain Turbo-Petrol (TCMPFi) Turbo-Petrol (TGDi) Diesel Displacement 1197 cc 1197 cc 1497 cc Max Power 110 bhp @ 5000 rpm 129 bhp @ 5000 rpm 115 bhp @ 3750 rpm Peak Torque 200 Nm @ 1500-3500 rpm 230 Nm @ 1500-3750 rpm 300 Nm @ 1500-2500 rpm Transmission 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AT 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AT 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AMT Fuel efficiency 18.89 kmpl (MT)/ 17.96 kmpl (AT) 20.1 kmpl (MT)/ 18.2 kmpl (AT) 20.6 kmpl (MT)/ 21.2 kmpl (AMT) Surprisingly, the 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine with the higher state of tune is more frugal. But the diesel is unbeatable in terms of fuel efficiency as with the AMT it returns 21.2 kmpl. Pro - Ride Quality Mahindra has improved the already fantastic suspension from the XUV 300 with this facelift. The result is a steady ride. On big bumps, it is very poised and even smaller bumps are dealt with ease. Pro - Safety Features Theres a plethora of safety features on offer with the XUV 3XO. It gets 6 airbags, ESC, 3-point seatbelts with reminders for all seats and so many more safety features as standard. And then, the icing on the cake is that it's the first subcompact SUV with level 2 ADAS. Lets wait and watch how it performs at the Global NCAP crash tests. Pro - Prices Mahindra knocked it out of the park with the XUV 3XO. Only the Renault Kiger and Nissan Magnite have a lower starting price than the Mahindra. The top-end price of the XUV 3XO may be higher than its rivals but there is so much on offer here. While deliveries begin on May 26 it may be time before you get your hands on one if youre not one of those 50,000 people. Bharat NCAP is a safety assessment program introduced by the Government of India. It aims to test and rate vehicles for their safety based on crash test results, safety features, and protection for both adults and children. The program evaluates cars on a scale of 1 to 5 stars, with five stars representing the highest level of safety. luxury_safety_features.text: [{'url': 'https://www.team-bhp.com/news/2024-mahindra-xuv-3xo-review-8-pros-7-cons', 'content': "2024 Mahindra XUV 3XO Review : 8 Pros & 7 Cons | Team-BHP Skip to main content About Us | Advertise | Contact Us Forum Hot Threads News Reviews Photos Buy Used Car Spare Parts Buy Accessories Classifieds Store News 2024 Mahindra XUV 3XO Review : 8 Pros & 7 Cons 8th May 2024, 12:20 by Omkar Shendge View Forum Discussion It gets a refreshed exterior, some changes to the interiors, quite a few feature additions and a new 6-speed Aisin-sourced automatic gearbox for its petrol engines. Mahindra XUV 3XO Pros A truly premium crossover. Nice build, quality & refinement levels Cabin has enough space for 5. Quality-wise, the interior is more like a Hyundai Fantastic petrol & diesel engine line-up; they offer fast performance & good driveability Finally gets a smooth torque converter automatic with the turbo-petrol engines Wide variant spread ensures there's something for everyone A compliant ride with sorted road manners 5-star NCAP rating & kit. Level 2 ADAS, 6 airbags, ESP, ABS, all-wheel disc brakes, TPMS, seatbelt reminders for all & more Loaded to the gills with equipment (360-degree camera, big sunroof, drive modes, Harman Kardon audio system, wireless smartphone connectivity, auto headlamps & wipers etc.) Mahindra XUV 3XO Cons The new edgy & outlandish design may not be to everyone's liking. Some love it, some don't. It is very polarizing Top-end variants are expensive. Not overpriced, but definitely higher than expected 295-liter boot is the smallest in the segment. There are cheaper hatchbacks that have a larger boot No proper diesel automatic option, just a jerky AMT which has no place in a premium crossover Light & disconnected steering is the biggest drawback in a competent handling package Mahindra's after-sales service quality is a hit or miss. Auto Industry Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling sub-compact SUV with segment-leading safety, powerful engines and new style in the market. NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 Facebook Telegram WhatsApp Twitter Copy Link The sub-compact SUV in India witnesseda huge disruption with the launch of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in April 2024. This heavily redesigned XUV300 successor has created a lot of buzz in the market, promising to fix the shortcomings of the previous model and introduce segment-first features. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications Specification Details Price Range Rs. 7.99 15.80 Lakh (ex-showroom) Engine Options 1.2L Turbo Petrol (110 bhp), 1.2L TGDi (129 bhp), 1.5L Diesel (115 bhp) Transmission 6-speed Manual, 6-speed Automatic, 6-speed AMT Safety Rating 5-star BNCAP Mileage 17.96-21.2 kmpl (ARAI) Boot Space 295 liters Fuel Tank 42 liters Ground Clearance 201 mm Wheelbase 2600 mm Seating Capacity 5 passengers Engine and Variants The XUV 3XO continues with the same set of engines seen on theolder version, with three options. The base 1.2-litre turbo petrol makes 110 bhp and 200 Nm, good enough for city driving with decent fuel efficiency of around 17-19 kmpl. The highlight is new 1.2-litreTGDi direct injection petrol, good 129 bhp and 230 Nm. Theres adequate mid-rangepunch in this engine and highway overtaking is a breeze. The new torque converter automatic transmission works well with both petrol engines, smoother than the jerky AMT. For diesel lovers, the 1.5-litre turbo diesel continues to be the best in class with 300 Nm torque. The manual transmission is seamless, but the AMT is reluctant in lower gears, especially in stop-and-go traffic. Design and Styling Updates Mahindra has completely redesigned the XUV 3XOs exterior. The new front face features vertically arranged headlamps with C-shaped LED DRLs, making itlook related to the XUV700. The wide grille has diamond-shaped detailing and connected LED tail-lamps. The side profile has chunky cladding and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels on higher variants. But the styling is divisive, some find it bold and fresh while others think its too dramatic for the segment. Interior Space and Features The cabin is a big upgrade over the previous model. Mahindra has given the XUV 3XO a free-standing 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system and matching digital instrument cluster, same as the XUV700. Space is excellent, with class-leading rear legroom for 5 adults. The dashboard has soft-touch materials and premium finishes on higher variants and plenty of storage spaces for practicality. Key Features: Panoramic sunroof (segment-first) Dual-zone automatic climate control 360-degree camera system Electronic parking brake with auto-hold Level 2 ADAS on top variants Safety and Build The XUV 3XOs biggest achievement is its 5-star BNCAP rating, making it one of the safest in the segment. All variants come with six airbags, all-wheel disc brakes and comprehensive safety features like ABS, EBD and ESP. Higher variants get advanced driver assistance features like forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist. The build quality is robust and users often praise it as tank-like. But is it a good buy? Contents The XUV 3XO is not a new-gen model but an extensive facelift. And its just not on the design front, but also the offerings. Mahindra received more than 50,000 bookings within an hour, so things have started on a positive note. So should you ride the wave and buy it? Well, we tell you both sides of the story. Pro - Powertrain Options Carried over from the XUV300, the XUV 3XO comes with a variety of powertrain options. You have a choice of a turbo-petrol engine in two states of tune and a diesel engine as well. You also get the option of a 6-speed manual, a 6-speed AMT and the new Aisin-sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic. Powertrain Turbo-Petrol (TCMPFi) Turbo-Petrol (TGDi) Diesel Displacement 1197 cc 1197 cc 1497 cc Max Power 110 bhp @ 5000 rpm 129 bhp @ 5000 rpm 115 bhp @ 3750 rpm Peak Torque 200 Nm @ 1500-3500 rpm 230 Nm @ 1500-3750 rpm 300 Nm @ 1500-2500 rpm Transmission 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AT 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AT 6-Speed MT/ 6-Speed AMT Fuel efficiency 18.89 kmpl (MT)/ 17.96 kmpl (AT) 20.1 kmpl (MT)/ 18.2 kmpl (AT) 20.6 kmpl (MT)/ 21.2 kmpl (AMT) Surprisingly, the 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine with the higher state of tune is more frugal. But the diesel is unbeatable in terms of fuel efficiency as with the AMT it returns 21.2 kmpl. Pro - Ride Quality Mahindra has improved the already fantastic suspension from the XUV 300 with this facelift. The result is a steady ride. On big bumps, it is very poised and even smaller bumps are dealt with ease. Pro - Safety Features Theres a plethora of safety features on offer with the XUV 3XO. It gets 6 airbags, ESC, 3-point seatbelts with reminders for all seats and so many more safety features as standard. And then, the icing on the cake is that it's the first subcompact SUV with level 2 ADAS. Lets wait and watch how it performs at the Global NCAP crash tests. Pro - Prices Mahindra knocked it out of the park with the XUV 3XO. Only the Renault Kiger and Nissan Magnite have a lower starting price than the Mahindra. The top-end price of the XUV 3XO may be higher than its rivals but there is so much on offer here. While deliveries begin on May 26 it may be time before you get your hands on one if youre not one of those 50,000 people. Bharat NCAP is a safety assessment program introduced by the Government of India. It aims to test and rate vehicles for their safety based on crash test results, safety features, and protection for both adults and children. The program evaluates cars on a scale of 1 to 5 stars, with five stars representing the highest level of safety. The XUV 3XO secured this accolade for both adult and child occupant protection, underlining Mahindras focus on providing world-class safety features in its vehicles. This latest recognition comes on the heels of Bharat NCAP's recent safety assessments of other prominent SUVs, including Tata models and the Citroen Basalt, as well as Mahindras own Thar Roxx and XUV 400 EV, both of which also earned 5-star ratings. The XUV 3XO demonstrated strong safety performance in multiple areas of testing. It achieved a remarkable total score of 29.36 out of 32 for adult occupant protection. In the frontal offset deformable barrier test, the SUV exhibited excellent protection for the co-driver, with good ratings across all body regions. However, the driver's chest, legs, and feet received ratings of adequate to marginal due to the impact forces recorded during the collision. Despite these minor deductions, protection to the driver's head, hip, and thigh was rated as good, reinforcing the XUV 3XOs overall structural integrity and crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO excelled in the side barrier and pole impact tests, securing a full 16 out of 16 points . These tests assess the SUVs ability to protect front-seat occupants in scenarios where side impacts pose a significant threat. Mahindras engineering expertise was evident, as the SUV delivered comprehensive protection to the head, chest, abdomen, and pelvis, showcasing its robust design and stringent safety standards. In terms of child occupant safety, the XUV 3XO also performed admirably, earning a total score of 43 out of 49 . While the SUV dropped a few points in the vehicle assessment score, it still received full marks in both the dynamic crash test and the child restraint system (CRS) parameters. The test evaluated the ability of child restraint systems to effectively secure young passengers during high-impact situations. The XUV 3XO accommodated CRS installations with ease, ensuring full protection for child passengers. Bharat NCAP tested both the fully loaded AX7 L variant and the entry-level MX2 variant of the XUV 3XO. The safety ratings are applicable across all variants, reflecting Mahindras commitment to offering consistent safety standards, regardless of trim level. The XUV 3XOs impressive safety performance is backed by a comprehensive suite of standard safety features. The SUV comes equipped with six airbags as a standard offering across all trims, ensuring superior protection for all occupants. Additionally, Electronic Stability Control (ESC) and Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) are standard, enhancing the vehicles stability and control in various driving conditions. Seat belt reminders are also provided for all seating positions, encouraging passengers to use seat belts at all times and thereby boosting overall safety. For customers opting for the higher-end variants, Mahindra offers Level 2 Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) . This package includes features such as adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking, adding another layer of safety and convenience for drivers. These technologies are designed to mitigate the risk of collisions and assist drivers in maintaining optimal control over the vehicle. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. About Wikipedia Disclaimers Search Mahindra XUV 3XO Article Talk Language Watch Edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact crossover SUV produced by the Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra , based on the X100 platform of Mahindra XUV300 . It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] (S220) Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview Manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra Model code S220 Production 2024present Assembly India: Nashik , Maharashtra Body and chassis Class Subcompact crossover SUV Bodystyle 5-door SUV Layout Front-engine, front-wheel-drive Platform X100 Platform Related Mahindra XUV300 KGM Tivoli Powertrain Engine Petrol : 1.2 L mStallion TCMPFi I3 turbo 1.2 L mStallion T-GDi I3 turbo Diesel : 1.5 L 4D15 CRDe I4 turbo Transmission 6-speed Manual 6-speed automated manual 6-speed automatic Dimensions Wheelbase 2,600mm (100in) Length 3,995mm (157.3in) Width 1,821mm (71.7in) Height 1,617mm (63.7in) Kerbweight 1,362kg (3,003lb) Contents 1 Overview 2 Specifications 3 Variants 4 Powertrain 5 Features 6 Safety 7 References 8 External links Overview edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications edit The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants edit The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain edit The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. The petrol engines are offered with a choice of 6-speed manual or an Aisin sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic transmission, while the diesel engine can be had with a 6-speed manual or a 6-speed automated manual transmission marketed as 'AutoSHIFT+'. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. This review delves into the top model, the AX7 L, showcasing its range of features, design, and performance. Price and Variants : The XUV 3XO comes in both petrol and diesel versions, starting at an ex-showroom price of 7.49 lakh, with the top model priced at 15.49 lakh. The electric version, named the XUV400, also starts at 15.49 lakh. Design and Assembly : The vehicle boasts the Heartcore design philosophy and has been designed by Pratap Bose. Its built on the KG Mobility Tivoli platform and assembled in Nashik, India. This design collaboration between Mahindras India design studio in Mumbai and the Mahindra Research Valley in Chennai results in a robust yet elegant SUV. Dimensions and Exterior Features : Exterior highlights include LED fog lamps, a piano black grille, Bi-LED projector headlamps with LED DRLs, and Infinity LED tail lamps. The Mahindra XUV 3XO impresses with its compact yet robust dimensions, spanning 4 meters in length, 1.8 meters in width, and 1.6 meters in height, combined with a 5.3 meter turning radius and a ground clearance of 201 mm. It can wade through water up to 350 mm deep, showcasing its capability for mild off-roading adventures. Mahindra XUV300, 3XO sales cross 335,000 units, up 80% in FY2025 The XUV 3XO, which is the refreshed XUV300, has given a new charge to this compact SUVs sales. Not only are its sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 up 80% YoY and already its highest in a fiscal but with February-March 2025 numbers yet to be pencilled in, the XUV 3XO will hit 100,000 units in FY2025. In the process, this models sales since launch on February 14, 2019, will also surpass 350,000 units. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12980 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. Scorpio, Thar, Bolero, XUV3X0, XUV700 Mahindra Sales Breakup June 2025 Scorpio, Thar, Bolero, XUV3X0, XUV700 Pearl Daniels July 11, 2025 New Mahindra XUV3XO REVX Launched Mahindra took the second spot on the sales list for June 2025 with total wholesales of 47,306 SUVs Mahindra is the 2nd best-selling automaker for June 2025. Sales grew significantly on a YoY basis by 18% while its MoM sales declined by 10%. The company currently commands a 14.9% market share. Mahindra sales in June 2025 stood at 47,306 units. This related to a healthy 18% YoY growth from 40,022 units sold in June 2024. However, its MoM sales fell by 10% when compared to 52,431 unit sales of May 2025 . Mahindra Sales Breakup June 2025 Mahindra Scorpio / N topped sales charts with sales of 12,740 units. This was positive YoY growth of 4% from 12,307 units in June 2024. As sales had stood at 14,401 units in May 2025, it was a 12% MoM decline. Mahindra Thar / ROXX continued its stellar performance in June 2025 with 9,542 units sold. This was a hefty 77%YoY improvement in sales over 5,376 units sold in the same month last year. Nevertheless, sales dipped by 8% MoM. Mahindra Sales Breakup June 2025 YoY Comparison At No. 3 in the company portfolio was the Bolero with 7,478 unit sales last month. It displayed a marginal 2% YoY growth while MoM sales fell by 16%. Sales declined both YoY and MoM for the XUV3XO as numbers fell to 7,089 units. With the launch of new XUV 3XO RevX , the numbers are expected to increase in coming months. Last month, the Mahindra XUV700 has witnessed a 5% YoY increase to 6,198 units, over 5,928 unit sales of June 2024. Like every other model (except the Marazzo) in the company portfolio, XUV700 sales dipped by 4% on a MoM basis. Mahindra BE 6 and XEV 9e Mahindras BE 6 and XEV 9e electric SUVs have been gaining momentum in domestic markets. The company is now set to initiate deliveries of Pack Two of these two electric SUVs from later this month. XEV 9e sales stood at 2,808 units last month while the company also sold 1,203 units of the BE 6. Mahindra Sales Breakup June 2025 MoM Comparison Lower sales were reported for the XUV400 of which only 231 units were sold last month. This related to a 57% YoY and 20% MoM decline. Mahindra Marazzo, on the other hand, has seen outstanding improvement in demand. It was the only model in the company portfolio to post both YoY and MoM growth and that too by a huge percentage. Marazzo sales grew by 42% YoY to 17 units from just 12 unit sales of June 2024. It showed exceptional MoM improvement by 325% when compared to just 4 units sold as of May 2025. Mahindra Sales Breakup Q2 CY 2025 Mahindra Sales Breakup Q2 CY 2025 Mahindra has posted an impressive 22.39% year-on-year growth in overall sales for Q2 CY 2025, selling 1,52,067 units compared to 1,24,248 units in Q2 CY 2024. Leading the charge is the Scorpio/N with 42,675 units, while the Thar/ROXX range more than doubled its sales, growing by a strong 77.22% YoY. The newly introduced electric models, XEV 9e and BE 6, contributed significantly with 8,064 and 2,959 units respectively. The XUV 3XO and XUV700 also showed stable performances, with modest but positive growth. final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: 

**Introduction**
The Mahindra XUV 3XO is the latest entrant in the competitive sub-compact SUV segment, aiming to capture market share with a compelling blend of features, performance, and value. This report provides a detailed analysis of the XUV 3XO, focusing on its key selling points, innovative technologies, and unique aspects that differentiate it from competitors. However, sales data and trend analysis are not included in this report due to data unavailability.

**Key Selling Points**

*   **Competitive Pricing:** The XUV 3XO is positioned as a value-for-money offering in its segment, with a competitive starting price that undercuts many of its rivals. Mahindra has strategically priced the XUV 3XO to appeal to budget-conscious buyers seeking a feature-rich SUV.
*   **Extensive Feature List:** Even in the lower trims, the XUV 3XO comes equipped with a respectable array of features. Higher trims boast a comprehensive list of amenities, including a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, digital instrument cluster, panoramic sunroof, and advanced safety features. 
*   **Bold and Modern Styling:** The XUV 3XO features a distinctive and contemporary design, with a diamond-themed motif evident in its headlight design, exterior trim, and alloy wheels. The bold styling sets it apart from more conservatively designed competitors.
*   **Strong Safety Credentials:** Safety is a key focus for Mahindra, and the XUV 3XO reflects this commitment with a 5-star BNCAP safety rating. All variants come standard with six airbags, ABS, EBD, and ESP. Higher trims add Level 2 ADAS for enhanced safety.
*   **Multiple Powertrain Options:** The XUV 3XO offers a choice of petrol and diesel engines, catering to diverse customer preferences. Both manual and automatic transmission options are available, including a smooth torque converter automatic for the petrol engines.

**Innovative Technologies**

*   **10.25-inch Touchscreen Infotainment System:** This large touchscreen provides seamless access to navigation, media, and other vehicle functions. Wireless smartphone connectivity is also available.
*   **10.25-inch Digital Instrument Cluster:** The digital instrument cluster displays essential driving information in a clear and customizable format.
*   **Panoramic Sunroof:** A segment-first feature that enhances the sense of spaciousness and luxury in the cabin.
*   **Dual-Zone Automatic Climate Control:** Allows independent temperature settings for the driver and front passenger.
*   **360-Degree Camera System:** Provides a bird's-eye view of the vehicle's surroundings, making parking and maneuvering easier.
*   **Electronic Parking Brake with Auto-Hold:** Simplifies parking and prevents the vehicle from rolling on inclines.
*   **Level 2 ADAS:** Includes advanced driver assistance features such as adaptive cruise control, lane keep assist, and autonomous emergency braking.

**Unique Aspects**

*   **Comprehensive Safety Kit:** The XUV 3XO sets itself apart by offering a comprehensive safety kit across all variants. The inclusion of six airbags as standard is particularly noteworthy.
*   **Multiple Transmission Choices:** Mahindra offers a variety of transmission options to suit different driving styles and preferences. The availability of a torque converter automatic with the petrol engines is a significant advantage.
*   **Striking Exterior Design:** The XUV 3XO's bold and modern styling distinguishes it from competitors. The diamond-themed motif and well-managed proportions contribute to its visual appeal.

**Competitive Landscape (Partial)**

Without specific sales data, it's challenging to provide a complete competitive analysis. However, based on available feature information, the XUV 3XO competes against models such as the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Nissan Magnite, and Renault Kiger.

**Strengths:**

*   Competitive pricing
*   Extensive feature list
*   Strong safety credentials
*   Multiple powertrain options
*   Bold styling

**Weaknesses:**

*   Boot space (295 liters) is among the smallest in the segment.
*   Subjective design that may not appeal to all buyers.

**Recommendations**

*   Focus marketing efforts on highlighting the XUV 3XO's safety features and BNCAP rating.
*   Emphasize the value proposition of its competitive pricing and extensive feature list.
*   Address concerns about boot space by showcasing clever storage solutions and versatile interior.

**Risks or Warnings**

*   Waiting periods can affect the success of the car.

**Key Factors Considered**

*   Features and specifications
*   Safety ratings
*   Engine and transmission options
*   Styling and design
*   Price and value proposition

final_report.summary: Mahindra XUV 3XO achieves 5-star Bharat NCAP rating with standard 6 airbags, ESC, and ABS. Higher trims include Level 2 ADAS. The following report provides a detailed safety analysis, comparison to industry standards, and identification of potential areas for improvement.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: 

**Mahindra XUV 3XO: A Comprehensive Safety Analysis**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has entered the competitive subcompact SUV market with a strong emphasis on safety. The vehicle has secured a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, indicating a high level of occupant protection in simulated crash scenarios. This report provides an in-depth analysis of the XUV 3XO's safety features, compares them to industry benchmarks, and identifies potential areas for improvement.

**Bharat NCAP Rating: A Detailed Breakdown**

The XUV 3XO's 5-star rating from Bharat NCAP is based on its performance in various crash tests. The key findings are:

*   **Adult Occupant Protection:** Scored 29.36 out of 32 points. Excellent protection for the co-driver was noted, with 'good' ratings across all body regions. However, the driver's chest, legs, and feet received ratings of 'adequate to marginal' due to impact forces.
*   **Child Occupant Protection:** Scored 43 out of 49 points. The XUV 3XO performed admirably, securing full marks in both the dynamic crash test and the child restraint system (CRS) parameters.

The Bharat NCAP testing involved both the fully loaded AX7 L variant and the entry-level MX2 variant, and the safety ratings are applicable across all variants, highlighting Mahindras commitment to consistent safety standards.

**Standard Safety Features**

The XUV 3XO comes equipped with a range of standard safety features designed to protect occupants in the event of a collision and prevent accidents from occurring. These include:

*   **Six Airbags:** Standard across all trims, providing enhanced protection for all occupants.
*   **Electronic Stability Control (ESC):** Enhances vehicle stability and control, particularly in adverse driving conditions.
*   **Anti-lock Braking System (ABS):** Prevents wheel lock-up during braking, improving steering control.
*   **Seat Belt Reminders:** For all seating positions, encouraging seat belt use for all passengers.

**Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS)**

Higher-end variants of the XUV 3XO offer Level 2 ADAS, which includes a suite of advanced safety technologies designed to assist the driver and mitigate the risk of collisions. These features include:

*   **Adaptive Cruise Control:** Automatically adjusts vehicle speed to maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead.
*   **Lane-Keeping Assist:** Helps the driver keep the vehicle within its lane by providing steering assistance.
*   **Autonomous Emergency Braking (AEB):** Automatically applies the brakes to prevent or mitigate a collision.

**Comparison to Industry Standards**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO's safety features and Bharat NCAP rating compare favorably to other subcompact SUVs in the Indian market. Many competitors offer similar standard safety features such as airbags, ABS, and ESC. However, the XUV 3XO's 5-star rating positions it as one of the safest vehicles in its class. Level 2 ADAS, while available on some competitors, is not as widely offered as standard, giving the XUV 3XO a competitive advantage.

**Potential Weaknesses and Areas for Improvement**

While the XUV 3XO performs well in crash tests and offers a comprehensive suite of safety features, there are some potential weaknesses and areas for improvement:

*   **Driver's Chest, Legs, and Feet Protection:** The 'adequate to marginal' ratings for the driver's chest, legs, and feet in the frontal offset deformable barrier test suggest that there is room for improvement in these areas. Mahindra could focus on enhancing the structural design and energy absorption capabilities of the vehicle's front end to provide better protection for the driver.
*   **ADAS Performance:** While Level 2 ADAS is a valuable addition, the effectiveness of these systems depends on their calibration and performance in real-world driving conditions. Further testing and refinement of the ADAS algorithms could improve their reliability and effectiveness.
*   **ADAS Availability:** While ADAS is available on higher-end variants, it is not offered on lower trims. Making ADAS available as an option across all trims could improve the overall safety of the XUV 3XO lineup.
*   **Rollover Protection:** While the provided data mentions ESC, it doesn't explicitly detail rollover protection measures. Further information on rollover stability and roof strength would be beneficial.

**Recommendations**

Based on the analysis, the following recommendations are made to further enhance the safety of the Mahindra XUV 3XO:

1.  **Improve Driver Protection:** Focus on improving the protection of the driver's chest, legs, and feet in frontal collisions through structural enhancements and optimized energy absorption.
2.  **Refine ADAS Performance:** Conduct extensive testing and refinement of the ADAS algorithms to improve their reliability and effectiveness in various driving scenarios.
3.  **Expand ADAS Availability:** Offer ADAS as an option across all trims to make advanced safety technologies more accessible to a wider range of customers.
4.  **Enhanced Rollover Protection:** Provide specific details about rollover protection measures, including roof strength and electronic stability control effectiveness in preventing rollovers.
5.  **Public Awareness:** Educate consumers about the safety features of the XUV 3XO and how they contribute to overall vehicle safety. This can help increase customer confidence and drive sales.

**Conclusion**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a safe and well-equipped subcompact SUV that offers a high level of occupant protection. Its 5-star Bharat NCAP rating and comprehensive suite of standard safety features make it a competitive choice in the Indian market. By addressing the potential weaknesses identified and implementing the recommendations outlined in this report, Mahindra can further enhance the safety of the XUV 3XO and solidify its position as a leader in vehicle safety.

**Table 1: Mahindra XUV 3XO Safety Features**

| Feature                    | Availability                               | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| -------------------------- | ------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Airbags                    | Standard (6 airbags)                       | Provides cushioning and protection to occupants in the event of a collision.                                                                                                                                                   |
| ESC                        | Standard                                   | Enhances vehicle stability and control, particularly in adverse driving conditions.                                                                                                                                                   |
| ABS                        | Standard                                   | Prevents wheel lock-up during braking, improving steering control.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Seat Belt Reminders         | Standard (all seating positions)          | Reminds occupants to fasten their seat belts, increasing their safety in the event of a collision.                                                                                                                                      |
| Level 2 ADAS               | Higher-end variants                        | Includes adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking, assisting the driver and mitigating the risk of collisions.                                                                               |
| ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors   | Standard                                  | Allows for secure installation of child safety seats, protecting young passengers in the event of a collision.                                                                                                                          |


**Table 2: Mahindra XUV 3XO Bharat NCAP Rating**

| Category                   | Score    | Description                                                                                                      |
| -------------------------- | -------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Adult Occupant Protection  | 29.36/32 | Measures the level of protection provided to adult occupants in the event of a collision.                           |
| Child Occupant Protection  | 43/49    | Measures the level of protection provided to child occupants in the event of a collision.                           |

**Risks or Warnings:**

*   While the XUV 3XO has a 5-star safety rating, real-world accident scenarios can vary greatly. Driver behavior, road conditions, and the nature of the impact can all affect the outcome of a collision.
*   ADAS features are designed to assist the driver, but they are not a substitute for safe driving practices. Drivers should always remain attentive and in control of the vehicle.

**Key Factors Considered:**

*   Bharat NCAP crash test results
*   Availability of standard and advanced safety features
*   Comparison to industry standards and competitor vehicles
*   Potential weaknesses and areas for improvement

These features, including premium interior materials, advanced technology, and comfort enhancements, appeal to a target demographic seeking value and style. However, the effectiveness of these features is contingent on their execution, reliability, and overall contribution to a premium feel.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: The Mahindra XUV 3XO aims to democratize luxury by offering features typically found in higher-priced vehicles within the compact SUV segment. A thorough analysis of these features is essential to understand their value, appeal to the target customer, and overall contribution to the ownership experience.

**Interior Materials and Design:**
The XUV 3XO boasts features like soft-touch leatherette on door trims and dashboard, and premium leatherette seats in certain variants. The perceived luxury of these materials relies on their quality, durability, and the overall design aesthetic. While leatherette offers a more premium feel than standard fabric, it's crucial to assess its tactile quality and resistance to wear and tear. The design of the dashboard and door trims also contributes to the overall sense of luxury. A well-designed interior can elevate the perceived value of even relatively inexpensive materials.

*Value Assessment:* Leatherette seats and soft-touch materials contribute to a more upscale cabin environment. However, the specific type and quality of the leatherette used are important factors. High-quality leatherette can closely mimic the look and feel of genuine leather, while lower-quality versions may feel plasticky or artificial.

*Target Customer Appeal:* For the target customer seeking a stylish and comfortable vehicle, these interior upgrades can be a significant draw. They provide a tangible sense of luxury without the hefty price tag of genuine leather.

*Contribution to Ownership Experience:* A more comfortable and visually appealing interior enhances the driving experience. However, the durability and ease of maintenance of these materials are also important considerations.

**Comfort and Convenience Features:**
The vehicle features a skyroof (sunroof), cooled glovebox with illumination, passive keyless entry, a front armrest with storage, and a console with a cup holder. These features enhance convenience and comfort, contributing to a more relaxed and enjoyable driving experience.

*Value Assessment:* The skyroof adds a sense of spaciousness and airiness to the cabin. The cooled glovebox is a practical feature for keeping beverages and snacks cool, especially in hot weather. Passive keyless entry enhances convenience by allowing drivers to unlock and start the car without using a key. The armrest and cup holder provide added comfort and convenience for both driver and passengers.

*Target Customer Appeal:* These features align well with the needs of a target customer seeking a comfortable and convenient vehicle for daily commutes and weekend trips. The skyroof is particularly appealing to those who value a sense of openness and connection to the outdoors.

*Contribution to Ownership Experience:* These comfort and convenience features contribute significantly to the overall ownership experience by making the vehicle more user-friendly and enjoyable to drive.

**Infotainment and Connectivity:**
The XUV 3XO includes a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system, a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation, and built-in Amazon Alexa integration. These features enhance entertainment and connectivity, providing a modern and immersive driving experience.

*Value Assessment:* The Harman Kardon audio system delivers high-quality sound, enhancing the enjoyment of music and podcasts. The high-definition touchscreen provides a clear and responsive interface for accessing infotainment and navigation features. Amazon Alexa integration allows drivers to control various vehicle functions using voice commands.

*Target Customer Appeal:* The target customer, particularly younger demographics, is likely to value these advanced technology features. A high-quality audio system and seamless connectivity are essential for many drivers today.

*Contribution to Ownership Experience:* These features significantly enhance the driving experience by providing entertainment, information, and connectivity on the go. However, the user-friendliness and reliability of the infotainment system are crucial factors.

**Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems (ADAS):**
While not explicitly mentioned in the provided data, Level-2 ADAS is highlighted as a USP in some sources. This includes features like adaptive cruise control, lane departure warning, and automatic emergency braking, which enhance safety and driving convenience.

*Value Assessment:* ADAS features add significant value by improving safety and reducing driver fatigue. These systems can help prevent accidents and make driving more comfortable, especially on long trips.

*Target Customer Appeal:* Safety is a high priority for many car buyers, and ADAS features can be a major selling point. These features appeal to customers who value safety and convenience.

*Contribution to Ownership Experience:* ADAS features enhance the overall driving experience by making the vehicle safer and more comfortable to drive. However, the effectiveness and reliability of these systems are crucial factors.

**Comparison to Competitors:**
To truly assess the luxury features of the XUV 3XO, it's essential to compare them to those offered by competitors in the compact SUV segment, such as the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, and Maruti Suzuki Brezza. The XUV 3XO's features need to stand out in terms of quality, functionality, and value to be considered a competitive advantage.

**Conclusion:**
The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury features that aim to enhance the ownership experience and appeal to a target customer seeking value and style. These features, including premium interior materials, advanced technology, and comfort enhancements, contribute to a more upscale and enjoyable driving experience. However, the success of these features depends on their execution, reliability, and overall contribution to a premium feel. Continuous improvement and a focus on customer feedback are essential for Mahindra to maintain a competitive edge in the compact SUV segment.

**Recommendations:**
*   **Conduct thorough quality control:** Ensure all luxury features meet high standards of quality and durability.
*   **Gather customer feedback:** Continuously collect feedback on the perceived value and effectiveness of the luxury features.
*   **Compare against competitors:** Regularly assess the XUV 3XO's features against those of its competitors to identify areas for improvement.
*   **Invest in marketing:** Highlight the luxury features in marketing materials to attract the target customer.
*   **Offer customization options:** Provide customers with options to customize the luxury features to suit their individual preferences.

**Risks or Warnings:**
*   **Overstating luxury:** Avoid overstating the 'luxury' aspect if the features are merely 'premium' for the segment, as this could lead to customer disappointment.
*   **Reliability issues:** Any reliability issues with the luxury features could damage the brand's reputation and negatively impact customer satisfaction.

**Key Factors Considered:**
*   Interior Materials and Design
*   Comfort and Convenience Features
*   Infotainment and Connectivity
*   Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems (ADAS)
*   Comparison to Competitors

final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: ## Mahindra XUV 3XO Sales Data and Trend Analysis

This report analyzes the sales data and trends for the Mahindra XUV 3XO, identifies potential drivers of sales performance, and provides a comparison with its competitors based on available data. The analysis is based on web search results gathered up to June 2025.

### Sales Performance Overview

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has shown a mix of positive and negative sales trends. In June 2025, sales totaled 7,089 units, representing a 10.85% month-over-month (MoM) decline. However, year-on-year (YoY) analysis shows a significant growth of 80% in FY2025, driven by the introduction of the refreshed XUV 3XO model in April 2024. This indicates that the model refresh has been a crucial factor in boosting sales.

*   **June 2025 Sales:** 7,089 units (10.85% MoM decline)
*   **FY2025 Growth (Up to Jan 2025):** 80% YoY increase
*   **Cumulative Sales (Since launch):** 335,017 units (as of end-January 2025)

### Key Sales Drivers

1.  **Model Refresh (XUV 3XO):** The introduction of the XUV 3XO in April 2024 has significantly accelerated sales. Year-on-year, Mahindra has sold an additional 38,318 units due to the new model. The refreshed model accounted for 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025, surpassing the previous best of 60,968 units in FY2023.
2.  **Safety Ratings:** Mahindra's heightened focus on safety, with the XUV 3XO, Thar Roxx, and XUV400 achieving 5-star Bharat NCAP crash test ratings, has positively influenced consumer perception and sales.
3.  **New Variant Launches (XUV 3XO RevX):** The launch of the new XUV 3XO RevX is expected to further increase sales in the coming months.

### Competitive Landscape

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes in the B2-segment SUV market. Key competitors include:

*   Kia Sonet
*   Hyundai Venue
*   Tata Nexon
*   Maruti Brezza
*   Renault Kiger
*   Citroen C3
*   Maruti Fronx
*   Nissan Magnite

While specific sales data for these competitors is not provided in the search results, the documents reference their existence. For example, V3Cars.com mentions the Kia Sonet, Hyundai Venue, Tata Nexon, and Maruti Brezza, among others. Carbike360.com also lists the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, and Tata Punch.

### Sales Trends

*   **Growth in Q2 CY2025:** Mahindra posted a 22.39% YoY growth in overall sales for Q2 CY2025, selling 152,067 units compared to 124,248 units in Q2 CY2024. This growth was driven by the Scorpio/N and Thar/ROXX models, which more than doubled their sales.
*   **Mahindra's Market Share:** Mahindra held a 14.9% market share in June 2025, ranking as the second best-selling automaker. Total wholesales were 47,306 SUVs.
*   **Model-Specific Trends:** The Scorpio/N topped sales charts with 12,740 units. The Thar/ROXX followed with 9,542 units. The Bolero recorded 7,478 unit sales. The XUV700 had 6,198 unit sales. Electric SUVs, XEV 9e and BE 6, contributed 2,808 and 1,203 units respectively. XUV400 sales declined significantly to 231 units.

### Impact of Pricing

There are references to price increases for the XUV 3XO, effective from October 6th. Price hikes of up to Rs 30,000 were implemented for select variants. The impact of these price changes on sales figures needs to be further investigated.

### Detailed Sales Figures

| Month    | Sales No. | Source       |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ |
| Jan 2025 | 8,454     | v3cars.com   |
| Feb 2025 | 7,861     | v3cars.com   |
| Mar 2025 | 7,055     | v3cars.com   |
| Apr 2025 | 7,568     | v3cars.com   |
| May 2025 | 7,952     | v3cars.com   |
| Jun 2025 | 7,089     | v3cars.com   |

### Recommendation

To gain a more comprehensive understanding of the XUV 3XO's performance, it is recommended to:

1.  Gather specific sales data for key competitors (Kia Sonet, Hyundai Venue, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza) to enable a direct comparison.
2.  Analyze the XUV 3XO sales figures by variant to identify the most popular models.
3.  Evaluate the impact of pricing changes on sales volumes.

### Risks and Warnings

*   The analysis is limited by the available data, which does not include comprehensive competitor sales figures. Any comparison should be viewed with this limitation in mind.
*   The report is based on data up to June 2025. More recent sales data should be analyzed to provide an up-to-date view of the XUV 3XO's performance.

### Key Factors Considered

*   Sales data and trends for the Mahindra XUV 3XO
*   Impact of model refresh and new variant launches
*   Influence of safety ratings
*   Competitive landscape in the B2-segment SUV market
*   Pricing changes and their potential impact

It offers multiple powertrain options and aims to deliver a luxurious experience within its segment. Sales data shows a mix of performance, with YoY growth driven by the model refresh but recent MoM declines. Key competitors include Kia Sonet, Hyundai Venue, and Tata Nexon. report_content.market_landscape_overview: The sub-compact SUV segment is highly competitive, with numerous players vying for market share. The XUV 3XO competes against models like Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Nissan Magnite, and Renault Kiger. Key market drivers include increasing urbanization, rising disposable incomes, and a preference for compact SUVs with enhanced safety and features. The XUV 3XO distinguishes itself through its focus on safety, offering 6 airbags as standard across all variants and a 5-star BNCAP rating.

These technologies contribute to a modern and feature-rich driving experience. The Level 2 ADAS includes adaptive cruise control, lane keep assist, and autonomous emergency braking.
report_content.company_profiles: Since this report focuses on the Mahindra XUV 3XO, detailed company profiles are not directly relevant. Mahindra & Mahindra is an Indian multinational automotive manufacturing corporation headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It is one of the largest vehicle manufacturers in India and a part of the Mahindra Group.
report_content.competitive_analysis: The XUV 3XO competes fiercely with established players in the sub-compact SUV segment. Its competitive advantages include its aggressive pricing, extensive feature list, and strong safety credentials. However, its boot space is smaller compared to some competitors. The XUV 3XO aims to offer luxury features typically found in higher-priced vehicles, appealing to customers seeking value and style.
report_content.risk_assessment: Key risks for the XUV 3XO include potential reliability issues with its luxury features and the subjective nature of its design. Waiting periods can also affect its success. Overstating the 'luxury' aspect could lead to customer disappointment. Furthermore, real-world accident scenarios can vary greatly, and ADAS features are not a substitute for safe driving practices.
report_content.strategic_recommendations: Mahindra should focus marketing efforts on highlighting the XUV 3XO's safety features and BNCAP rating, emphasizing the value proposition of its competitive pricing and extensive feature list. They should also address concerns about boot space by showcasing clever storage solutions. Continuous quality control of luxury features and gathering customer feedback are essential.

The data was analyzed to identify key selling points, safety features, luxury features, and sales trends. Limitations include the lack of comprehensive competitor sales data and the reliance on data up to June 2025.
report_content.appendices: Appendices include detailed tables on safety features, Bharat NCAP ratings, and monthly sales data (Jan-Jun 2025), as provided in the context.
report_content.key_selling_points: The Mahindra XUV 3XO's key selling points include its competitive pricing, extensive feature list, bold and modern styling, and strong safety credentials, including a 5-star BNCAP rating. The availability of multiple powertrain options caters to a wide range of customer preferences.
report_content.innovative_technologies: Innovative technologies include a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system with wireless connectivity, a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster, segment-first panoramic sunroof, dual-zone automatic climate control, 360-degree camera system, electronic parking brake with auto-hold, and Level 2 ADAS on higher variants.
report_content.unique_aspects: Unique aspects include its comprehensive safety kit across all variants (6 airbags standard), the availability of both petrol and diesel engines with multiple transmission choices, and its striking exterior design. The integration of Level 2 ADAS in a sub-compact SUV at this price point is also notable.
report_content.safety_analysis: Mahindra XUV 3XO achieves a 5-star Bharat NCAP rating with standard 6 airbags, ESC, and ABS. Higher trims include Level 2 ADAS. The 'adequate to marginal' ratings for the driver's chest, legs, and feet in the frontal offset deformable barrier test suggest that there is room for improvement in these areas.
report_content.luxury_features_analysis: The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers several features aimed at enhancing the ownership experience and perceived luxury, including premium interior materials (leatherette), a skyroof, cooled glovebox, passive keyless entry, a Harman Kardon audio system, and Amazon Alexa integration.

Auto Industry Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style Mahindra XUV 3XO Review: 5-Star Safety Meets Bold New Style The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling sub-compact SUV with segment-leading safety, powerful engines and new style in the market. NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 NITISH MAJUMDER June 5, 2025 Facebook Telegram WhatsApp Twitter Copy Link The sub-compact SUV in India witnesseda huge disruption with the launch of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in April 2024. This heavily redesigned XUV300 successor has created a lot of buzz in the market, promising to fix the shortcomings of the previous model and introduce segment-first features. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications Specification Details Price Range Rs. 7.99 15.80 Lakh (ex-showroom) Engine Options 1.2L Turbo Petrol (110 bhp), 1.2L TGDi (129 bhp), 1.5L Diesel (115 bhp) Transmission 6-speed Manual, 6-speed Automatic, 6-speed AMT Safety Rating 5-star BNCAP Mileage 17.96-21.2 kmpl (ARAI) Boot Space 295 liters Fuel Tank 42 liters Ground Clearance 201 mm Wheelbase 2600 mm Seating Capacity 5 passengers Engine and Variants The XUV 3XO continues with the same set of engines seen on theolder version, with three options. The base 1.2-litre turbo petrol makes 110 bhp and 200 Nm, good enough for city driving with decent fuel efficiency of around 17-19 kmpl. The highlight is new 1.2-litreTGDi direct injection petrol, good 129 bhp and 230 Nm. Theres adequate mid-rangepunch in this engine and highway overtaking is a breeze. The new torque converter automatic transmission works well with both petrol engines, smoother than the jerky AMT. For diesel lovers, the 1.5-litre turbo diesel continues to be the best in class with 300 Nm torque. The manual transmission is seamless, but the AMT is reluctant in lower gears, especially in stop-and-go traffic. Design and Styling Updates Mahindra has completely redesigned the XUV 3XOs exterior. The new front face features vertically arranged headlamps with C-shaped LED DRLs, making itlook related to the XUV700. The wide grille has diamond-shaped detailing and connected LED tail-lamps. The side profile has chunky cladding and 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels on higher variants. But the styling is divisive, some find it bold and fresh while others think its too dramatic for the segment. Interior Space and Features The cabin is a big upgrade over the previous model. Mahindra has given the XUV 3XO a free-standing 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system and matching digital instrument cluster, same as the XUV700. Space is excellent, with class-leading rear legroom for 5 adults. The dashboard has soft-touch materials and premium finishes on higher variants and plenty of storage spaces for practicality. Key Features: Panoramic sunroof (segment-first) Dual-zone automatic climate control 360-degree camera system Electronic parking brake with auto-hold Level 2 ADAS on top variants Safety and Build The XUV 3XOs biggest achievement is its 5-star BNCAP rating, making it one of the safest in the segment. All variants come with six airbags, all-wheel disc brakes and comprehensive safety features like ABS, EBD and ESP. Higher variants get advanced driver assistance features like forward collision warning, autonomous emergency braking, adaptive cruise control and lane-keep assist. The build quality is robust and users often praise it as tank-like. Mahindra received more than 50,000 bookings within an hour, so things have started on a positive note. So should you ride the wave and buy it? Well, we tell you both sides of the story. Pro - Powertrain Options Carried over from the XUV300, the XUV 3XO comes with a variety of powertrain options. You have a choice of a turbo-petrol engine in two states of tune and a diesel engine as well.
